newsitem.title: USA: Tosco to restart hydrocracker in July.
newsitem.headline: Tosco to restart hydrocracker in July.

text.p: A hydrocracker shut five months ago at Tosco Corp's refinery in Avon, Calif., will return to service in July, a company spokesman said on Friday.
The gasoline and diesel-making unit was shut by an explosion and fire January 21 that killed one worker and injured 25.
"Sometime in July we will start up the hydrocracker," said Tosco spokesman Hayden Noel. "We're not exactly sure when."
A report by Tosco, released Thursday, attributed the fire to a high temperature increase that ruptured a pipe.
The 32,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) unit converts heavier oils into gasoline and diesel fuel.
On June 3, the 38-page report will also be presented to members of the Contra Costa County Board of Supervisors, which oversees the town where the refinery is located.
